questions: How is overlapping differences different from cross-cutting differences ?
answers: Social differences which overlap other differences are known as overlapping differences, while when social differences cross-cut one another, it is known as cross-cutting differences.  Cross-cutting social differences are easier to accommodate, while overlapping differences are not.  Overlapping social differences create possibilities of deep social divisions and tensions, while crosscutting differences do not usually lead to conflicts.
